The secure deletion script effectively overwrote files with random data, making traditional recovery methods less effective. The challenge lies in the complexity of the data overwriting process.

A breakthrough was the realization that even after secure deletion, residual data might still exist in slack space, unallocated clusters, or as fragments detectable through data carving techniques.

Results and Impact: 
The session resulted in a comprehensive plan of action for attempting data recovery. While success is not guaranteed due to the nature of secure deletion, the process itself is valuable for developing forensic analysis skills.

content.paragraph: The focus of this session was on forensic analysis and did not involve the development of new code. However, the provided PowerShell script was critically analyzed:

content.heading: Securely deletes files by overwriting them with random data and then deleting them.

content.paragraph:
function Secure-Delete {
    param([string]$path)
    $files = Get-ChildItem -Path $path -Recurse -Force
    foreach ($file in $files) {
        # Overwrite the file with random data
        $fileSize = (Get-Item $file.FullName).length
        $randomData = New-Object byte[] $fileSize
        (New-Object Random).NextBytes($randomData)
        [System.IO.File]::WriteAllBytes($file.FullName, $randomData)
        # Securely delete the file
        Remove-Item -Path $file.FullName -Force
    }
}
```
This script served as the basis for understanding the complexity of the data recovery challenge.
